qas.question: Who was a big influence on Smokey Robinson?
What label operated in Third Avenue?
What label became Detroit's most famous?

context: Other, prominent Motor City R&B stars in the 1950s and early 1960s was <a0_0>Nolan Strong<a0_0/>, Andre Williams and Nathaniel Mayer – who all scored local and national hits on the Fortune Records label. According to Smokey Robinson, Strong was a primary influence on his voice as a teenager. The <a1_0>Fortune<a1_0/> label was a family-operated label located on Third Avenue in Detroit, and was owned by the husband and wife team of Jack Brown and <a2_0>Devora Brown<a2_0/>. Fortune, which also released country, gospel and rockabilly LPs and 45s, laid the groundwork for <a3_0>Motown<a3_0/>, which became Detroit's most legendary record label.
